Old monster/Injuries
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher EVO Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q & A: Old monster/Injuries
By Apocalypse on Tuesday, May 2, 2006 - 07:07 pm:

My Bargest (Tiger/Joker) had been having a fine career in MR Evo. He hit the point where he stopped gaining stats, and I decided to wait until he stopped gaining anima points. I am still waiting now, and that wouldn't even be an issue if it wasn't for the fact that he now gets injured constantly! He has been injured twice from doing nothing but training. It seems to me like I should retire it, but the combinations are terrible, due to the fact that he has not reached his maximum age. But at the same time I dont want a monster that is prone to injury. What should I do?

By VenomousX on Tuesday, May 2, 2006 - 07:46 pm:

Maybe give it a training gadget that is a lot easier, sometihng that doesnt raise the tiredness and stress as much, or if all else fails the very simple "performance" training. Also if you have it on one of the harder policies, maybe lower it a level.

By Apocalypse on Wednesday, May 3, 2006 - 12:38 pm:

I was thinking about maybe changing the policy, as it is on hard, although it has a compettitive nature and has been on hard its entire life.

I will probably lower it to normal

The Training Gadget idea is great though. Why put it on a red gadget if it doesn't gain stats? DUH!

Thank you.

By RPGDesigner on Wednesday, May 3, 2006 - 01:04 pm:

I'll tell ya why: Money.

Then again, that's what the other monsters are for.

By Apocalypse on Wednesday, May 3, 2006 - 01:27 pm:

^That is a good point,but I have a good amount of money right now anyway...

After a few months I can combine him anyway, and get a new cash-cow.

By kilak on Thursday, May 4, 2006 - 01:03 pm:

1st and 2nd gen (2nd slighter lower) monsters are extremely prone ot injury especially certain breeds tiger being one of them. I am finding it best to take the traits lively (and the upgrade cant remember what it is called ) they both help reduce injury.

using lower level gadgets will help as well. but it is not a foolproof solution.

a combination of both will eliminate (almost nearly) injuries but at the very least lively and its uprgrade will help a ton.

also the injuries really dont cause much trouble after they reach max potnetial and you can carry over anima to the next gen so you wont lose much depending on what you combine with

By Apocalypse on Thursday, May 4, 2006 - 01:49 pm:

^good. He was literally injured like 4 times. But I a sure I wil be fine thanks to all of your help. Thank you all.
